ClassifierService.description: For the common properties detail check the [Service](#/definitions/Service)

Id.description: Service unique identifier. It cannot be modified.

Alias.description:
Alias name of the service. Services can be accessed via this name.
Alias can be modified. It is unique amongst the services.

Status.description:
New - the service was created | 
Busy - the service is working on something (e.g.: during the Prepare) | 
Prepared - the service was prepared so you can activate it to use | 
Active - the service so you can use it

Type.description:
Type of the service.
Currently supported types:
- Classifier
- Prc

ProcessIdList.description: Contains all the process ids which belong to this service

ClassifierPrepareSettings.description: These settings are required for the training (Prepare method)

DataSetName.description: The DataSet name where the Classifier will be trained from

TagIdList.description: The list of the tag Ids which will be trained

NGramList.description: The list of the NGrams which will be trained. The maximum NGram can be the DataSet's NGram

ClassifierActivateSettings.description: These settings are required for the recommendation (Recommend method)

EmphasizedTagIdList.description: The list of the tag Ids which will emphasized during the recommendation

TagIdList.description: "The list of the tag Ids which will be activated (the recommendation will be contains these only)

NGramList.description: The list of the NGrams will be activated (the recommendation algorithm will be use these only)

Start.description: The UTC time of the process start

End.description: The UTC time of the process end

Percent.description: The percent of the whole process. (e.g.: 12.23 means 12.23%)

Status.description:
InProgress - the process is in progress, it's working |
Cancelled - the process was cancelled by the user |
Finished - the process was finished successfully |
Error - the process stopped by an error, see the ErrorMessages for detailed information |
Interrupted - the process was interrupted by an unknown event (e.g.: server restart) - under development |
Paused - the process was paused  - under development

Text.description: The text the you want to classify

Count.description: How many results you want to see in the response (default value is 3)

UseEmphasizing.description: Use emphasizing algorithm during this recommendation

NeedTagInResult.description: If you want to see all the tag object in the response

Score.description: The score that belongs to the tag id

IsEmphasized.description: If there was applied emphasizing by this tag

Id.description: The identifier of the tag. It must be unique across the DataSet

ParentId.description: The identifier of the parent of the tag. It must be the id of an existing tag

TagProperties.description: Contains calculated values for the tag

Paths.description: A tag list contains parent path elements

Level.description: The level of the tag in the hierarchy (root level is: 0)

IsLeaf.description: If the tag is a leaf tag. Leaf tag means the tag is not a parent of any other tags

Name.description: Name of your dataset. Can contains just A-Z letters, numbers, _ (underscore) and - (hyphen) without any space. This field is unique

NGramCount.description: To deeper analyze your text, a dataset uses ngram to index your document. You can set the ngramcount from 1 to 6

IdField.description: To identify a document you need to use IDs. You can use your own conventions to name your ID field, but in the settings you need to provide the field name of the id field from your sample document. Can contains just A-Z letters, numbers, _ (underscore) and - (hyphen) without any space

TagField.description: For text categorization, we provide a predefined document field to store your tags (or categories). If your documents are related to tags or categories, please insert here the tags field name from your sample JSON. Can contains just A-Z letters, numbers, _ (underscore) and - (hyphen) without any space

InterpretedFields.description: For text analysis, you can set those document fields that contains useful text content. Slamby is doing ngram analysis and text process related works on these fields. How to decide which field you need to set here? Only the interpreted field can be a part of text analyzes. To provide these fields just simply insert the needed text fields from your JSON document. Field names can contain just A-Z letters, numbers, _ (underscore) and - (hyphen) without any space

SampleDocument.description: Using flexible document schema, you can store all of your required data inside one simple dataset. To create a dataset with your required schema you can provide a sample document. The schema is flexible; the only requirement is using standard JSON format. Field names can contain just A-Z letters, numbers, _ (underscore) and - (hyphen) without any space

Schema.description: Using flexible document schema, you can store all of your required data inside one simple dataset. To create a dataset with your required schema you can provide a schema. The schema is flexible. Field names can contain just A-Z letters, numbers, _ (underscore) and - (hyphen) without any space

Name.description: Name of your dataset. Can contains just A-Z letters, numbers, _ (underscore) and - (hyphen) without any space. This field is unique

Documents.description: Array of the documents to be saved

Results.description: Array of the documents to be saved

BulkResult.description:
"Result of a bulk save element.
If the save was successful then the StatusCode is 2XX. 
If there was a problem, the StatusCode is not 2XX, and the error message is in the Error field.

FieldList.description: Query returns only with the specified field(s)

Limit.description: How many element you want to get back in this request

OrderDirection.description: The ordering of the list, Ascending or Descending

OrderByField.description: It must be an existing field. Declares the base of the ordering

TagIdList.description:
You can direct your search queries into specific tags. 
By giving the required tag id list, the filter will affect just the provided tags. 
It's useful to create powerful search queries inside given tags. 
To filter inside a whole dataset, you can set this field to empty

Query.description:
Set here the filters. The value is the query string you want to apply. 
Can be BOOL expressions. You can use these: AND, OR, NOT. 
For example: 'searchforthis AND NOT butnotthis'. 
Also you can use wildcards. For example: 'exampl*'. 
If you want to search in a specified field, than do this: 'title:searchthisinthetitle'

Items.description: Containing the actual displayed items. The type of the elements depend on the method

Count.description: The count of the actual returned items

Total.description: The count of all items which are the pagination applied

ScrollId.description: Identifier for the next series of items where it is applicable

Id.description:
It must be a random string for every new sampling, but must be the same for the same sampling during pagination. 
If you leave it empty then it'll be generated automatically, but then you can not use pagination

TagIdList.description:
You can create a sample from a whole dataset, or just from a given tag section. 
To create a sample from the whole dataset please keep it empty. 
To create a sample from a given number of tags please provide the tag ids

Percent.description:
Defining the sample size, you can use percentage or a given number. 
Using a percentage you can define the document number by a percentage. 
This percentage will calculate the document number by using the available dataset document number. 
E.g.: if your dataset contains 100.000 documents and you are using 10% as a sampling size without stratified method, your sample size is 100.000 x 10% = 10.000

Size.description:
Define your sample size by providing a simple integer. 
E.g.: if your dataset contains 100.000 documents and you are using 3.000 as a sampling size without stratified method, your sample size is 3.000

FieldList.description: Query returns only with the specified field(s)

DocumentIdList.description: The Id list of the documents you want to copy

TargetDataSetName.description: The DataSet name where you want to copy the selected documents

DocumentIdList.description: The Id list of the documents you want to move

TargetDataSetName.description: The DataSet name where you want to move the selected documents

Content.description: The text content of sent document. Can be empty.

Title.description: The title of the document. Can be null or empty.

Author.description: The author of the document. Can be null or empty.

Keywords.description: Keywords of the document. Can be null or empty.

ContentType.description: The type of the document (e.g.: application/pdf). Can be empty.

ContentLength.description: The length of the received document.

Language.description: Detected language of the document (e.g.: en). Can be empty.

Id.description: Service unique identifier. It cannot be modified.

Alias.description:
Alias name of the service. Services can be accessed via this name.
Alias can be modified. It is unique amongst the services.

Status.description:
New - the service was created | 
Busy - the service is working on something (e.g.: during the Prepare) | 
Prepared - the service was prepared so you can activate it to use | 
Active - the service so you can use it

Type.description:
Type of the service.
Currently supported types:
- Classifier
- Prc

ProcessIdList.description: Contains all the process ids which belong to this service

Text.description: The text which you want to extract the keywords from

TagId.description: The extracting keywords calculation depends on this Tag. Prc Service try to detect it automatically if it's not provided

Query.description:
Set here the filters. The value is the query string you want to apply. 
Can be BOOL expressions. You can use these: AND, OR, NOT. 
For example: 'searchforthis AND NOT butnotthis'. 
Also you can use wildcards. For example: 'exampl*'. 
If you want to search in a specified field, than do this: 'title:searchthisinthetitle'

Set here the filters. The value is the query string you want to apply. 
Can be BOOL expressions. You can use these: AND, OR, NOT. 
For example: 'searchforthis AND NOT butnotthis'. 
Also you can use wildcards. For example: 'exampl*'. 
If you want to search in a specified field, than do this: 'title:searchthisinthetitle'

SearchService.description: For the common properties detail check the [Service](#/definitions/Service)

Id.description: Service unique identifier. It cannot be modified.

Alias.description:
Alias name of the service. Services can be accessed via this name.
Alias can be modified. It is unique amongst the services.

Status.description:
New - the service was created | 
Busy - the service is working on something (e.g.: during the Prepare) | 
Prepared - the service was prepared so you can activate it to use | 
Active - the service so you can use it

Type.description:
Type of the service.
Currently supported types:
- Classifier
- Prc

ProcessIdList.description: Contains all the process ids which belong to this service

DataSetName.description: The name of the DataSet in which this service will search

AutoCompleteSettings.description:
The AutoComplete settings to activate (as default setting for all search)
For the details of this setting check [AutoCompleteSettings](#/definitions/AutoCompleteSettings)

SearchSettings.description:
The Search settings to activate (as default setting for all search)
For the details of this setting check [SearchSettings](#/definitions/SearchSettings)

ClassifierSettings.description:
The Classifier settings to activate (as default setting for all search)
For the details of this setting check [ClassifierSettings](#/definitions/ClassifierSettings)

AutoCompleteSettings.description: The AutoComplete settings. The AutoComplete is using the [ElasticSearch Phrase Suggester](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/search-suggesters-phrase.html)

Confidence.description: The confidence level defines a factor applied to the input phrases score which is used as a threshold for other suggest candidates. Only candidates that score higher than the threshold will be included in the result. For instance a confidence level of 1.0 will only return suggestions that score higher than the input phrase. If set to 0.0 the top N candidates are returned. The default is 1.0.

MaximumErrors.description: The maximum percentage of the terms that at most considered to be misspellings in order to form a correction. This method accepts a float value in the range [0..1) as a fraction of the actual query terms or a number >=1 as an absolute number of query terms. The default is set to 1.0 which corresponds to that only corrections with at most 1 misspelled term are returned

Count.description: The number of candidates that are generated for each individual query term. Low numbers like 3 or 5 typically produce good results. Raising this can bring up terms with higher edit distances

SearchSettings.description: The Search settings. The search is using ElasticSearch MATCH or QUERYSTRING search. Depends on the Type setting

UseDefaultFilter.description: When you activate a Search service with a Filter, you can use this property to control if you want to use that 'default filter' during each searches

Weights.description: Can use each available dataset field, a preferred value and a weighted score between 0 and 10 to boost the result

UseDefaultWeights.description: When you activate a Search service with Weights, you can use this property to control if you want to use that 'default weights' during each searches

ResponseFieldList.description: Which dataset fields must be in the search response

SearchFieldList.description: In which fields you would liket to search. The list can contains boosts. For example: title^2  which means matches on the title field will have twice the weight as those on the other fields

Type.description: The type of the search. Can be MATCH (default) which means a simple word based search or can be QUERY which means you can use expressions in the query, like in the [QueryString Query](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/query-dsl-query-string-query.html#query-string-syntax) in ElasticSearch

CutOffFrequency.description: Allows specifying an absolute or relative document frequency where high frequency terms are moved into an optional subquery and are only scored if one of the low frequency (below the cutoff) terms in the case of an OR operator or all of the low frequency terms in the case of an AND operator match

Fuzziness.description: Interpreted as a Levenshtein Edit Distancethe number of one character changes that need to be made to one string to make it the same as another string. Can be specified as: -1 (generates an edit distance based on the length of the term) or 0, 1, 2 (the maximum allowed Levenshtein Edit Distance)

Operator.description:
Can be set to OR or AND to control the operators between the text words
For example if the operator is AND, and the query is: 'white mobilephone' then the 'white' AND the 'mobilephone' must be match the documents
If the operator is OR in the same query then one of the query words is enough for a match. Of course if a document matches all the words then that will have a higher score

Order.description:
You can change the order of the search results. You have to specify a field of the dataset the order (Ascending or Descending)
Be careful with this, if you change the default order then not the most relevant (for the text) documents will be on the top

Id.description: The Alias or the ID of the Classifier

Count.description: How many results the Classifier should response

Text.description: A simple text or a Query String query, depends on the Type of the search

AutoCompleteSettings.description: You can override the activated AutoCompleteSettings during each search. Null means the activated settings will be used

SearchSettings.description: You can override the activated SearchSettings during each search. Null means the activated settings will be used

ClassifierSettings.description: You can override the activated ClassifierSettings during each search. Null means the activated settings will be used

ClassifierResultList.description: List of the Classifier results of the input text

SearchResultList.description: The matched documents with relevance scores

AutoCompleteResult.description: Contains a suggestion for the input text

Text.description: The suggested text instead of the original text

Score.description: The score of the suggestion relevance

ClassifierResultList.description: The related Classifier results for this suggested text

SearchResultMatch.description: If the recommended category is matched any of the search-matched documents categories

Score.description: The score that belongs to the tag id

IsEmphasized.description: If there was applied emphasizing by this tag

SearchResult.description: A search result, actually a document itself with a relevance score

Document.description: The document itself but ONLY the FIELDS that you request with the RESPONSEFIELDLIST parameter

Id.description: Service unique identifier. It cannot be modified.

Alias.description:
Alias name of the service. Services can be accessed via this name.
Alias can be modified. It is unique amongst the services.

Status.description:
New - the service was created | 
Busy - the service is working on something (e.g.: during the Prepare) | 
Prepared - the service was prepared so you can activate it to use | 
Active - the service so you can use it

Type.description:
Type of the service.
Currently supported types:
- Classifier
- Prc

ProcessIdList.description: Contains all the process ids which belong to this service

StatisticsWrapper.description: Statistics object, describes the usage statistics of periods (months)

Sum.description: The sum of all requests of all time

Statistics.description: dictionary of the statistics, the key is the month of the actual stastistics. The format is yyyy-MM

Sum.description: The sum of all requests count in the current period

Action.description: An action which is measured by the statistics. Currently it is equivalent with the API endpoints

Name.description: The endpoint name with the HTTP method (if there are multiple HTTP methods for an endpoint)

Count.description: The request count for this action in the current period

ProcessorCount.description: Number of processors on the API machine

AvailableFreeSpace.description: Available free disk space in MB

TagBulkSettings.description: Stores complete tag hierarchy for bulk insert
